author: wsjcom
title: ISDS Procedure is the Baby, Not Bath Water
text:
Your editorial “A Nafta Poison Pill” (April 10) is right to criticize U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer’s disdain for the investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) provisions in the ongoing Nafta negotiations. ISDS is critical to the continued success of U.S. companies doing business abroad.
ISDS provisions in Nafta and many other agreements protect the interests of U.S. companies in investment disputes. Rather than leave American business interests to the whims of foreign governments and sometimes incompetent foreign...
